result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricco X. Roberts

09:24 AM
Defendant, Ricco X. Roberts, appeared with Attorney Brenda L VanCuick.  Defendant in-custody.
Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES: 
Victim rights compliance.
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, def. revoked on another case.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Ricco X. Roberts appeared with Attorney Brenda L VanCuick.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.

201PM    Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Mike Barth and Atty VanCuick.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on February 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued as previously set.  Atty Barth moves to withdraw as he was appointed by SPD and DE has retained Atty VanCuick.  Court grants request.  ts

Defendant Ricco X. Roberts in court, in custody.  Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *No Weapons especially firearms.

136PM   Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kelly Leibhan.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on January 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Defendant is on a PO Hold. $7500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
